The '''Hyundai Ioniq 5''' ({{langx|ko|현대 아이오닉 5}}) is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]]<ref name="cd2023" /> produced by [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] since 2021. It is the first product to be marketed under the electric cars-focused [[Ioniq]] sub-brand, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]].<ref>{{cite news |author1=Joey Capparella |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Production EV Previewed before February Reveal |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |access-date=15 January 2021 |date=13 January 2021 |archive-date=29 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210329110807/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

== Overview ==
The Ioniq 5 was revealed globally on 23 February 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Revealed With Concept Look, Ultra-Fast Charging |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070351/https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref> Its design was previewed by the Hyundai 45 EV Concept which was presented at the [[International Motor Show Germany#2019|Frankfurt Motor Show]] in September 2019. Both the concept car and the production version are inspired by the original [[Hyundai Pony]],<ref>{{Cite web|last=Meiners|first=Jens|date=12 April 2021|title=1970s Hyundai Pony Restored with EV Powertrain, Ultra-Cool Interior|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|access-date=2 July 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=17 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210417052442/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|url-status=live}}</ref> and features the Parametric Pixel design that is applied to the headlights, tail lights, and wheels. The vehicle's clamshell hood spans the entire width to make a sleek look with the 20-inch aerodynamic wheels.<ref>{{Cite news|title=미래형 전기차 '아이오닉 5' 이미지 첫 공개… "살짝 설렜어 난"|work=[[Seoul Shinmun]]|url=https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver|url-status=live|access-date=13 January 2021|archive-date=28 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128004911/https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver}}</ref> The "45" describes both the 45th anniversary of the Pony coupe and the 45-degree angles prominent on the sides of the concept.<ref>{{cite news |author=Priddle, Alisa |date=10 September 2019 |title=Remember the Hyundai Pony? EV Concept Honors Brand's First Car in Frankfurt |work=Motor Trend |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/hyundai-pony-45-ev-concept-electric-compact-frankfurt-first-look/ |access-date=22 December 2021}}</ref> At the time, Hyundai called the design language "sensuous sportiness" and described the front and rear lights as carrying a "kinetic cube" theme.<ref>{{cite news |author=Halvorson, Bengt |date=11 September 2019 |title=Hyundai hatches an electric future with retro 45 EV concept |work=Green Car Reports |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1124993_hyundai-hatches-an-electric-future-with-retro-45-ev-concept |access-date=22 December 2021}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 was developed under the project code ''NE'' as the first vehicle to be based on the E-GMP platform.<ref>{{cite web|author=Florent Ferrière|date=10 August 2020|title=Hyundai : Ioniq devient une marque, premier modèle en 2021|url=https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|access-date=15 September 2020|archive-date=24 September 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200924210726/https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Brett T.|title=Hyundai Teases Upcoming 2022 Ioniq 5 EV With Three Images|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/d|access-date=15 January 2021|website=motor1.com|archive-date=9 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211009144028/https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/|url-status=live}}</ref> The dedicated electric vehicle platform enables the vehicle to adopt a fully flat interior floor with a 3-meter long wheelbase. The flat floor allows Hyundai engineers to develop a sliding front central console marketed as 'Universal Island', which is able to slide backwards by {{cvt|140|mm|in|1}}. The vehicle has a cargo capacity of {{cvt|531|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} behind the rear seats that can be increased to nearly {{cvt|1600|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} with the second row seats folded. The rear legroom space was achieved by making the front seats approximately 30 percent thinner than typical seats.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Ruffo |first=Gustavo Henrique |date=2023-02-24 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Revealed As Sleek, Stylish CUV: It's Not A Hatchback |url=https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223074826/https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

The dashboard of the Ioniq 5 is made up of two 12-inch screens: a instrument cluster display and the touchscreen infotainment system, both under one piece of glass. It is equipped with an optional [[head-up display]] with [[augmented reality]] support. Many of the interior parts are made from recycled materials, including [[PET bottles]]. The Ioniq 5 can be optioned with a single large glass panel roof without any support beams.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Beresford|first=Colin|date=23 February 2021|title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Kicks Off EV Lineup in Eye-Catching Style|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070421/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|url-status=live}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 also features a front boot (alternatively called a frunk), which has a {{cvt|57|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity for the RWD version (except North America), while the AWD model and all North American versions have a {{cvt|24|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity, due to the extra mechanical components underneath to support the front electric motor.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 revealed with impressive numbers, concept car looks|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Autoblog|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070611/https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|url-status=live}}</ref> It has the ability to charge electrical equipment through the built-in [[Vehicle-to-grid|V2L (Vehicle to Load)]] function. It can supply up to 3.6{{nbsp}}kW of power from the port mounted under the rear seats (except Australia) and from another port installed outside. The exterior port is able to supply power even if the vehicle is turned off.

In some markets, the Ioniq 5 is offered with an optional Digital Side Mirror (DSM) which replaces the conventional side mirrors with cameras and [[OLED]] screens.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Digital Side Mirror Works Just Fine: Test Drive |url=https://insideevs.com/reviews/510105/hyundai-ioniq5-digital-side-mirror/ |access-date=2022-09-19 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

Hyundai Motor's Ioniq 5 EV will incorporate Waymo's autonomous driving technology and join its robotaxi service announced.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2024-10-04/business/tech/Hyundais-Ioniq-5-to-join-Waymos-robotaxi-fleet/2148387|title=Hyundai's Ioniq 5 to join Waymo's robotaxi fleet|access-date=22 October 2024|website=Korea JoongAng }}</ref>

== 2024 facelift ==
The facelifted Ioniq 5 was revealed on 24 March 2024. Changes include the addition of a rear hatch windshield wiper, and an updated infotainment system. A slightly bigger battery pack and some minor power efficiency or aerodynamics was also introduced.<ref>{{cite web |last1=George |first1=Patrick |title=The 2025 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets A Bigger Battery, More Buttons, Rear Wiper |url=https://insideevs.com/news/710930/2025-hyundai-ioniq-5-updates/ |website=Inside EVs |access-date=25 May 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Evans |first1=Sam |title=2025 Hyundai Ioniq 5 overhauled with new battery and big changes |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDL8Bw-XUvI |website=Electric Viking |date=4 March 2024 |publisher=YouTube.com |access-date=25 May 2024}}</ref> An N-Line variant was added to the improved Ioniq 5.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Padeanu |first=Adrian |title=The New Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Line Has More Buttons And A Rear Wiper |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/710893/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-line/ |access-date=2024-03-24 |website=Motor1}}</ref>

== {{anchor|N}} Ioniq 5 N ==
The Ioniq 5 N was introduced on 14 July 2023 during the [[Goodwood Festival of Speed]]. The variant is the top-of-the-line model, marketed under the [[Hyundai N]] performance sub-brand.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai has finally unleashed its electric 600bhp Ioniq 5 N |url=https://www.topgear.com/car-news/electric/hyundai-has-finally-unleashed-its-electric-600bhp-ioniq-5-n |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Top Gear |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Doll |first=Scooter |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 N debuts at Goodwood, kicking off new era of performance-cornering EVs |url=https://electrek.co/2023/07/13/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-debut-goodwood-new-performance-cornering-ev/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Electrek |language=en-US}}</ref>

The exterior changes include a revised front end with larger air intakes, with additional air curtains and air flaps for improved cooling. The rear portion gained a rear wiper, wing-type spoiler integrated with a triangular third brake light, and a rear [[Diffuser (automotive)|diffuser]]. With extended wheel arches and wider [[Axle track|track]], the Ioniq 5 N is {{cvt|50|mm|in|1}} wider than the standard model and also {{cvt|20|mm|in|1}} lower.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=2023-07-14 |title=2024 Hyundai Ioniq 5 N debuts - performance EV with 650 PS; simulated 8DCT, engine sounds; 0-100 in 3.4s - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2023/07/14/2024-hyundai-ioniq-5-n-debuts/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref>

The [[body in white]] structure of the Ioniq 5 N gains 42 additional welding points and {{cvt|2.1|m|in|0|abbr=on}} of additional adhesives for improved rigidity. The motor and battery mountings were also reinforced, while the [[subframe]]s were enhanced for lateral rigidity. Its power steering has a higher ratio and improved torque feedback.

The vehicle is equipped with two electric motors, providing a total of {{cvt|448|kW|PS hp|0}} and {{cvt|740|Nm|kgm lbft|sigfig=3}} of torque. Hyundai equipped the Ioniq 5 N with an N Grin Boost mode, allowing a maximum output of {{cvt|478|kW|PS hp|0}} and {{cvt|770|Nm|kgm lbft|sigfig=3}} of torque being released for 10 seconds. Hyundai claimed a {{cvt|0-100|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}} acceleration figure of 3.5 seconds, or 3.4 seconds with the N Grin Boost mode activated. The [[lithium-ion battery]] for this variant is also extended to 84 kWh.<ref name=":1" />

Several aspects were conceived to simulate an [[Internal combustion engine|internal combustion vehicle]]. An N e-shift function emulates the feel of a 8-speed [[Dual-clutch transmission|dual-clutch automatic]] transmission, by controlling motor torque to simulate the jolt between shifts. A system called N Active Sound+ uses eight interior and two exterior speakers to play three different sound themes based on throttle position, such as a 2.0-liter turbocharged petrol engine from other Hyundai N cars, futuristic EV themes and twin-engine fighter jet sounds.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-13 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N runs on electrons but simulates an ICE car |url=https://www.motorauthority.com/news/1140092_hyundai-ioniq-5-n-performance-revealed |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Motor Authority |language=en}}</ref><gallery widths="200" heights="130">

== Ioniq 5 eN1 Cup ==
During the Hyundai N festival in December 2023, Hyundai revealed concept images of the Ioniq 5 eN1 Cup car, a racing variant of the Ioniq 5 N, with the goal of finishing the development in February 2024. The car features an aerodynamic bodykit, including air intakes, a rear diffuser, and a rear wing. It also features a stiffer suspension setup, lowering the ride height by {{convert|2.8|in|mm|1}}. The car is also said to be about {{cvt|250|kg}} lighter than its road going counterpart.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Is Officially Going Racing |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/699916/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-cup/ |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref> Each racing team will have access to a special version of the Sound+ system, and drivers will be able to use N Grin Boost for extra power during overtakes, and N e-shift to add virtual gears. The Ioniq 5 eN1 Cup will start racing in late April 2024 in its own one-make EV series during the Hyundai N Festival in Korea.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pappas |first=Thanos |date=8 December 2023 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Spawns Electric Racecar For Single-Make Series |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2023/12/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-spawns-electric-racecar-for-single-make-series/ |access-date=18 December 2023 |website=carscoops.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Patrascu |first=Daniel |date=2024-03-31 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N eN1 Is a Very Complicated Way of Saying Badass Electric Race Car |url=https://www.autoevolution.com/news/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-en1-is-a-very-complicated-way-of-saying-badass-electric-race-car-231662.html |access-date=2024-03-31 |website=autoevolution |language=en}}</ref>

== Powertrain ==
From vehicle launch to mid-2022, the international market Long Range Ioniq 5 initially had 72.6 kWh gross battery pack, which has since then been upgraded to 77.4 kWh gross capacity, a 58 kWh gross battery pack is available for the Standard Range model. The North American version is only available with the 58 kWh for Standard Range models or the newer 77.4 kWh batteries for Long Range models. Every Ioniq 5 has a top speed of {{convert|185|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{Cite web|title=2022 Ioniq 5 revealed: Retro-styled electric car leads a New Wave of EVs|url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Green Car Reports|date=23 February 2021 |language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223094136/https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|url-status=live}}</ref>

The battery can recharge {{convert|86|km|mi|abbr=on}} of range in 5 minutes, or from 10 to 80% in 18 minutes, or {{convert|375|km|mi|abbr=on}} in half an hour<ref>{{cite web |last1=Klingenberg |first1=Mathias |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5: Plutselig kan elbilen fylle energi om kapp med bensinbilen |url=https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |website=Tu.no |publisher=[[Teknisk Ukeblad]] |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20210615170639/https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |archive-date=15 June 2021 |language=no |date=15 June 2021 |url-status=live}}</ref> with its 800{{nbsp}}V charging capabilities by using a 350{{nbsp}}kW charger. The peak battery speeds for the 58 kWh Standard Range are around 175 kW while it is around 230 kW on the 77.4 kWh Long Range. The 800{{nbsp}}V [[Power inverter|inverter]] is sourced from Vitesco Technologies, a subsidiary of the [[Continental AG|Continental]] group.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Randall|first=Chris|date=24 March 2021|title=Vitesco to deliver 800-volt inverters for Hyundai's E-GMP|url=https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|access-date=8 April 2021|website=Electrive|language=en-us|archive-date=25 March 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210325031900/https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|url-status=live}}</ref> A five minutes charge will add {{cvt|100|km|mi|0}} to its range by [[WLTP (driving cycle)|WLTP]] standards.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gitlin|first=Jonathan M.|date=23 February 2021|title=Here's the first of Hyundai's new 800-volt EVs—the Ioniq 5|url=https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Ars Technica|language=en-us|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223103405/https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|url-status=live}}</ref>

== Markets ==

=== North America ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in the U.S. in May 2021, and went on sale in December 2021 as a 2022 model year.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Gauthier |first=Michael |date=2021-12-13 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Offers 220 Miles Of Range For $39,700 While 303 Mile Variant Will Set You Back $43,650 |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/12/hyundai-ioniq-5-offers-220-miles-of-range-for-39700-while-303-mile-variant-will-set-you-back-43650/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}}</ref> The initial model year is equipped with a 77.4 kWh battery. The entry-level models are powered by a rear-mounted single motor producing {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the more powerful models are available as a dual-motor version with AWD and {{cvt|239|kW|PS hp|0}} power output.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Karkafiris |first=Michael |date=2021-05-24 |title=America's 2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Detailed, Here's Everything You Need To See And Know |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/05/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed-for-us-market-with-up-to-320-hp-and-up-to-300-miles-of-range/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}}</ref> A Standard Range model with a 58 kWh battery and a power output of {{cvt|125|kW|PS hp|0}} was released in spring 2022.<ref name=":0" /> Specific to the American and Canadian Ioniq 5, the vehicle is equipped a marker inside the headlamps, and tail lamps that blink completely as turn indicators.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-12-09 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5: Everything we know in Dec 2022 |url=https://topelectricsuv.com/news/hyundai/hyundai-ioniq-5-details-pre-orders/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=topelectricsuv.com |language=en-US}}</ref>

In Canada, Hyundai introduced the cheapest trim called the Essential for the 2022 model year only. The trim retailed at C$44,999, just below the C$45,000 threshold required (before April 2022) for the entire Ioniq 5 line-up to be eligible for Canada's Incentives for Zero-Emission Vehicles (iZEV) credit. The trim removed heat pump, a battery heater, and the ability to [[Direct current|DC]] fast charge. Described as a "[[Compliance car|compliance]]" trim, it is the only Ioniq 5 not equipped with a DC fast charge capability in the world. Hyundai discontinued the trim since the 2023 model year after selling only 30 units.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Stumpf |first=Rob |date=2023-04-25 |title=Canadian Driver Accidentally Buys Hyundai Ioniq 5 With No Fast Charging |url=https://www.thedrive.com/news/hyundai-ioniq-5-owner-shocked-to-find-no-fast-charging-port-on-ev-road-trip |access-date=2024-02-18 |website=The Drive |language=en}}</ref>

In November 2024, Hyundai introduced the 2025 model year Ioniq 5 for U.S. and Canada. It is built at [[Metaplant]], Hyundai's newly built electric vehicle manufacturing site located in [[Bryan County, Georgia]], U.S. In addition to the changes from the global market Ioniq 5 such as revised styling and larger battery size, the model also adopted the [[North American Charging System|North American Charging Standard]] (NACS) port and became available with more rugged XRT variant.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-11-11 |title=2025 Hyundai Ioniq 5 now U.S.-built for $43,957, adds Tesla NACS port |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1144325_2025-hyundai-ioniq-5-price |access-date=2024-12-07 |website=Green Car Reports |language=en}}</ref>

===Japan===
The Ioniq 5 was the first vehicle sold by Hyundai after it set pre-orders in May 2022 with deliveries made in July 2022 under Hyundai's newly established subsidiary in Japan, Hyundai Mobility Japan.<ref name="KN">{{Cite web|url=https://english.kyodonews.net/news/2022/02/7a8e4c100a02-south-koreas-hyundai-returns-to-japan-car-market-with-green-vehicles.html|title=South Korea's Hyundai returns to Japan car market with green vehicles|first=KYODO|last=NEWS|website=Kyodo News+}}</ref>

On May 22, 2024, official social media accounts of Hyundai Japan and [[Ghost in the Shell]] announced a collaboration to promote the Ioniq 5 N.<ref name="ANNGITH">{{cite web | url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2024-06-06/the-future-has-arrived-with-ghost-in-the-shell-hyundai-ioniq-5-n-electric-vehicle-ads/.211581 | title=The Future Has Arrived with Ghost in the Shell's Hyundai IONIQ 5 N Electric Vehicle Ads }}</ref> The Shibuya Tsutaya store hosted the Ioniq 5 N from  June 3 to June 22.<ref name="ANNGITH"/>

=== Europe ===
Initial models of the Ioniq 5 in Europe was offered with a choice of two battery packs (58 kWh and 72.6 kWh), three power outputs and either rear or four-wheel drive.<ref>{{Cite web |title=New 2021 Hyundai Ioniq 5: UK prices and specs confirmed |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/hyundai/107696/new-2021-hyundai-ioniq-5-uk-prices-and-specs-confirmed |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Auto Express |language=en}}</ref> During its introduction, a limited edition called the Project 45 was available, and only 3,000 units were made.<ref>{{Cite web |last=George |first=Jeo |date=2022-02-03 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Project 45 edition gets 3X expected response [Update] |url=https://electricvehicleweb.com/hyundai-ioniq-5-uk/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |language=en-US}}</ref>

In April 2022, the Ioniq 5 received a larger battery for the European market. The previous 72.6 kWh battery was replaced with a 77.4 kWh battery with an increased power output by {{cvt|8|kW|PS hp|0}} to {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the entry-level 58 kWh battery option remains. Optional Digital Centre Mirror (DCM) and Digital Side Mirrors (DSM) also became available.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets Larger 77.4 kWh Battery In Europe |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/581860/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-update/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Europe: 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Enhancements Announced |url=https://insideevs.com/news/566583/europe-2023-hyundai-ioniq5-enhancements/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>

=== Australia ===
The Ioniq 5 went on sale in Australia on 27 September 2021,<ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-09-21 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 pricing and features revealed for Australia |url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Carscoops |language=en}}</ref> in a sole trim, using the Long Range powertrain with the option between RWD (single motor) and AWD (dual motor) setups.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-09-20 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 pricing and features revealed for Australia |url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Which Car? Australia |language=en}}</ref> Three trim levels are available: Dynamiq, Techniq, and Epiq, with AWD standard on the top trim.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2023-01-19 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV pricing: More coming January 19|url=https://www.whichcar.com.au/news/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-pricing-features-australia-more-confirmed|access-date=2023-10-18|website=Which Car? Australia|language=en}}</ref> 

The facelifted model debuted on 23 July 2024, with the option of a N Line styling package.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Stopford |first=William |date=2024-07-23 |title=2025 Hyundai Ioniq 5 price and specs: EV gets new tech, sporty N Line trim |url=https://www.carexpert.com.au/car-news/2025-hyundai-ioniq-5-price-and-specs-ev-gets-new-tech-sporty-n-line-trim |access-date=2024-07-24 |website=CarExpert |language=en}}</ref>
=== Malaysia ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Malaysia on 9 March 2022, with three trim levels: Lite, Plus and Max. Two powertrain options are available: Standard Range (RWD) and Long Range (AWD), the latter powertrain comes standard on the top trim.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-03-09 |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched in Malaysia – 58 kWh, 72.6 kWh AWD, 430 km range, from RM199,888 |url=https://paultan.org/2022/03/09/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-in-malaysia-58-kwh-2wd-lite-plus-72-6-kwh-awd-max-from-rm200k/ |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Paul Tan Automotive News |language=en}}</ref>

=== Indonesia ===
Following multiple introductions since 26 October 2021,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Putra |first=Aries Aditya |date=2021-10-26 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Diperkenalkan di Indonesia, Kapan Mulai Dijual? |url=https://www.gridoto.com/read/222961380/hyundai-ioniq-5-diperkenalkan-di-indonesia-kapan-mulai-dijual |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=GridOto |language=id}}</ref> the Indonesian market Ioniq 5 was revealed in 31 March 2022 during the [[Indonesia International Motor Show#2022|29th Indonesia International Motor Show]], with pre-orders began in 1 April 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Haikal Wishnumurti |first=Rayhansyah |date=2022-03-31 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Meluncur di IIMS 2022, Langsung Unjuk Fitur V2L! |url=https://www.gridoto.com/read/223213504/hyundai-ioniq-5-meluncur-di-iims-2022-langsung-unjuk-fitur-v2l |access-date=2024-02-17 |website=GridOto |language=id}}</ref> It went on sale in 22 April 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Arifin |first=Ridwan |date=2022-04-22 |title=Pengumuman! Ini Harga Resmi Hyundai Ioniq 5 'Made In Cikarang' |url=https://oto.detik.com/mobil/d-6045151/pengumuman-ini-harga-resmi-hyundai-ioniq-5-made-in-cikarang |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=detikOto |language=id}}</ref> Initial variants for the Ioniq 5 were the Prime and Signature, with each type have the option between the Standard Range (58 kWh) and Long Range (72.6 kWh) battery packs.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-04-01 |title=Perbandingan 4 Varian Hyundai IONIQ 5, Akselerasi sampai Jarak Tempuh |url=https://otomotif.espos.id/perbandingan-4-varian-hyundai-ioniq-5-akselerasi-sampai-jarak-tempuh-1286128 |access-date=2022-11-19 |website=Espos Indonesia |language=id}}</ref>

It is locally assembled at the [[Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Indonesia|Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Indonesia (HMMI) plant]] in [[Cikarang]], [[Bekasi Regency|Bekasi]], [[West Java]], with its production was inaugurated by the [[President of Indonesia|7th President of Indonesia]], [[Joko Widodo]] in 16 March 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Humas |date=2022-03-16 |title=Presiden Jokowi Luncurkan Mobil Listrik Pertama Indonesia |url=https://setkab.go.id/presiden-jokowi-luncurkan-mobil-listrik-pertama-indonesia/ |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=Sekretariat Kabinet Republik Indonesia |language=id}}</ref> It is the first mass-produced battery electric vehicle to be built in Indonesia.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Rayanti |first=Dina |date=2022-03-16 |title=Jokowi Luncurkan Mobil Listrik Pertama 'Buatan' Indonesia, Hyundai Ioniq 5 |url=https://oto.detik.com/mobil/d-5986067/jokowi-luncurkan-mobil-listrik-pertama-buatan-indonesia-hyundai-ioniq-5 |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=detikOto |language=id}}</ref> Annual production target of the Ioniq 5 in the country is set up to 1,500 units per year.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kyong-ae |first=Choi |date=2022-05-01 |title=(LEAD) Orders for Hyundai's IONIQ 5 soar in Indonesia |url=https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20220501001551320 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=[[Yonhap News Agency]]}}</ref> Since April 2023, Hyundai increased the production rate from around 137 units to 1,000 units per month due to extremely high demand.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-04-17 |title=Pangkas Inden, Hyundai Tambah Pasokan Ioniq 5 Jadi 1.000 Unit Sebulan |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/otomotif/20230417150356-603-938839/pangkas-inden-hyundai-tambah-pasokan-ioniq-5-jadi-1000-unit-sebulan |access-date=2023-04-17 |website=CNN Indonesia |language=id}}</ref>

On 13 September 2023, the Ioniq 5 received an update to include [[Hyundai Blue Link|BlueLink]] telematics system as standard on all variants.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Priyantoro |first=Donny Dwisatryo |date=2023-09-13 |title=Mobil Listrik Ioniq 5 Kini Dilengkapi Teknologi Hyundai Bluelink |url=https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2023/09/13/154033915/mobil-listrik-ioniq-5-kini-dilengkapi-teknologi-hyundai-bluelink |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=Kompas |language=id}}</ref>

A limited edition variant called the Batik was unveiled in February 2024 at the [[Indonesia International Motor Show#2024|31st Indonesia International Motor Show]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Anshori |first=Luthfi |date=2024-02-15 |title=Hyundai Luncurkan 3 Mobil Listrik: Ioniq 5 Batik, All New Kona EV, Ioniq 7 Concept |url=https://oto.detik.com/mobil/d-7195064/hyundai-luncurkan-3-mobil-listrik-ioniq-5-batik-all-new-kona-ev-ioniq-7-concept |access-date=2024-02-16 |website=detikOto |language=id-ID}}</ref> Hence by its name, the variant sported several accents inspired by the [[Batik in Indonesia|traditional Indonesian batik culture]], particularly the [[Batik kawung|Kawung]] motif, featured on both of its exterior and interior.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pradifta |first=Aditya |date=2024-02-16 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Batik Disebut Rp 100 Juta Lebih Mahal, Dapat Apa Saja |url=https://www.gridoto.com/read/224018007/hyundai-ioniq-5-batik-disebut-rp-100-juta-lebih-mahal-dapat-apa-saja |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=GridOto |language=id}}</ref> Only 60 units were made.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nanda |first=Aprida Mega |date=2024-02-25 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Batik Cuma Tersedia 60 Unit |url=https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2024/02/25/152100315/hyundai-ioniq-5-batik-cuma-tersedia-60-unit |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=Kompas |language=id}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 N went on sale in July 2024 at the [[Indonesia International Auto Show#2024|31st Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show]], coinciding with the introduction of the Hyundai N performance sub-brand to the Indonesian market.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kurniawan |first=Ruly |date=2024-07-17 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Resmi Meluncur di Indonesia, Rp 1,8 Miliar |url=https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2024/07/17/151228715/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-resmi-meluncur-di-indonesia-rp-18-miliar |access-date=2024-07-17 |website=Kompas |language=id}}</ref> It is locally assembled alongside the regular Ioniq 5, making it the first performance electric vehicle to be built in Indonesia.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kurniawan |first=Ruly |date=2024-07-18 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Langsung CKD, Pengiriman Tercepat Oktober 2024 |url=https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2024/07/18/080200315/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-langsung-ckd-pengiriman-tercepat-oktober-2024 |access-date=2024-07-24 |website=Kompas |language=id}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-08-13 |title=Alasan Hyundai Berani Rakit Mobil Listrik Super di Indonesia |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/otomotif/20240813125328-603-1132417/alasan-hyundai-berani-rakit-mobil-listrik-super-di-indonesia |access-date=2024-11-19 |website=CNN Indonesia |language=id}}</ref>

=== Singapore ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Singapore in January 2023, in three trim levels: Exclusive, Prestige, and Inspiration, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Extra Long Range, with the top trim has AWD (dual motor) setup as standard. Assembled in the country at the [[List of Hyundai Motor Company manufacturing facilities#Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Center in Singapore|Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre]] facility, it is the first vehicle assembled in Singapore in more than 40 years. The plant will initially import the vehicle's fully painted body shell from the Indonesian plant, while other parts are imported from South Korea. The first 100 units are designated as the "First 100" limited edition, with "First 100" badging, "First 100" debossing on the seats, and commemorative number plates.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tan |first=Christopher |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai to roll out first S'pore-assembled cars in first half of 2023 {{!}} The Straits Times |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/hyundai-to-roll-out-first-s-pore-assembled-cars-in-first-half-of-2023 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=www.straitstimes.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 locally assembled in Singapore - CKD units of First 100 edition to get special Merlion badges - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2023/01/11/hyundai-ioniq-5-locally-assembled-in-singapore-ckd-units-of-first-100-edition-to-get-special-merlion-badges/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== India ===
The Ioniq 5 was introduced in India in January 2023 at the [[Auto Expo]]. It is Hyundai's second electric offering for India after the [[Hyundai Kona Electric|Kona Electric]], which was available in the country since 2019. Assembled in the country, the Indian model is solely powered by a 72.6 kWh battery with {{cvt|160|kW|PS hp|0}} and rear-wheel drive.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Auto Expo 2023: Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched at Rs 44.95 lakh |url=https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/auto-expo-2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-at-rs-4495-lakh-426904 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Autocar India}}</ref>

=== Philippines ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in the Philippines in February 2023, in a sole GLS trim, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-04 |title=Here Are The Full Specs Of The 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 For The Philippines |url=https://www.carguide.ph/2023/02/here-are-full-specs-of-2023-hyundai.html |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=CarGuide.PH |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-26 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV coming to dealers next month |url=https://www.autoindustriya.com/auto-industry-news/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-coming-to-dealers-next-month.html |access-date=2023-08-28 |website=Auto Industriya |language=en}}</ref> 

The Ioniq 5 N was launched in the Philippines on 5 April 2024 as a fully imported model, alongside the [[Hyundai Elantra|Elantra N]], as part of Hyundai N's arrival in the country.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai N Arrives In The Philippines With 2024 Elantra N, Ioniq 5 N (w/ Specs) |url=https://www.carguide.ph/2024/04/hyundai-n-arrives-in-philippines-with.html |access-date=2024-04-06 |website=CarGuide.PH {{!}} Philippine Car News, Car Reviews, Car Prices}}</ref>

=== Middle East ===
The Ioniq 5 was launched in the [[Gulf Cooperation Council|GCC]] countries in July 2023 with an option of RWD {{cvt|125|kW|PS hp|0}} single motor with a 58 kWh battery, or an AWD dual motor {{cvt|225|kW|PS hp|0}} with a 72.6 kWh battery.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq Car Prices, Specification, Variants & Features in UAE |url=https://carprices.ae/brands/hyundai/2023/ioniq |access-date=2023-10-12 |website=Carprices.ae |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai MEA launches the all-electric IONIQ range |url=https://www.tradearabia.com/news/MTR_416082.html |access-date=2023-11-24 |website=Trade Arabia}}</ref>

=== Vietnam ===
The Ioniq 5 was released in Vietnam on 31 July 2023. Assembled in Vietnam, it comes in Exclusive and Prestige trim levels, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 electric car officially produced and distributed in Vietnam, priced from 1,3 billion VND |url=https://www.vietnam.vn/en/xe-dien-hyundai-ioniq-5-chinh-thuc-san-xuat-va-phan-phoi-tai-viet-nam-gia-tu-13-ty-dong/ |website=vietnam.vn|date=31 July 2023 }}</ref>

=== Thailand ===
The Ioniq 5 was introduced in Thailand on 29 November 2023 at Thailand International Motor Expo 2023 by Hyundai's newly established subsidiary in Thailand, Hyundai Mobility Thailand. Imported from South Korea, with three trim levels offered are Premium, Exclusive and First Edition, with two powertrain options: Standard Range and Long Range, both use a RWD (single motor) setup.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-11-29 |title=ราคาอย่างเป็นทางการ Hyundai IONIQ 5 : 1,699,000 – 2,399,000 บาท แบต 58 – 72.6 kWh วิ่งไกลสุด 481 km. (WLTP) |trans-title=Official price Hyundai IONIQ 5 : 1,699,000 – 2,399,000 baht Battery 58 – 72.6 kWh Maximum range 481 km. (WLTP) |url=https://www.headlightmag.com/2023-11-29-official-price-hyundai-ioniq-5-thailand/ |access-date=2023-11-29 |website=HeadLight Magazine |language=th}}</ref>

The Ioniq 5 N was launched in Thailand on 26 September 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-09-26 |title=ราคาอย่างเป็นทางการ Hyundai IONIQ 5 N : 3,790,000 บาท {{!}} 650 แรงม้า 770 นิวตันเมตร 0-100 km/h 3.15 วินาที |url=https://www.headlightmag.com/2024-09-26-official-price-hyundai-ioniq-5n/ |access-date=2024-09-27 |website=HeadLight Magazine |language=th}}</ref>

=== Mexico ===
The Ioniq 5 was launched in Mexico on 4 July 2024, as the first battery electric vehicle by Hyundai to be marketed in Mexico. It is available with two variants: Limited Tech and the high-performance N model.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cervantes |first=Ricardo |date=2024-07-04 |title=El Hyundai Ioniq 5 ya tiene precio en México: un fascinante auto eléctrico con una versión deportiva que emociona como pocos |url=https://www.motorpasion.com.mx/industria/hyundai-ioniq-5-ioniq-5n-precio-mexico |access-date=2024-07-28 |website=Motorpasión México |language=es}}</ref>

== Concepts and prototypes ==
=== Robotaxi ===
The Ioniq 5 [[Robotaxi]] was unveiled on 31 August 2021 and displayed at IAA Mobility 2021 on 6 September 2021.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Hyundai's joint venture unveils basic design of robotaxi based on IONIQ 5 |work=[[Aju Business Daily]] |url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210901090352760 |access-date=1 September 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Motional To Launch Driverless Robotaxis in Las Vegas in 2023 |work=Forbes |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/samabuelsamid/2021/11/09/motional-to-launch-driverless-robotaxis-in-las-vegas-in-2023/?sh=1b1aa054714e |access-date=9 November 2021}}</ref> Lyft began offering transport by driverless Ioniq 5 Robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip on 16 August 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |date=16 August 2022 |title=Lyft offering driverless robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip |url=https://www.8newsnow.com/news/local-news/lyft-offering-driverless-robotaxis-on-the-las-vegas-strip/ |access-date=22 August 2022 |publisher=KLAS |language=en-US}}</ref> The Ioniq 5 Robotaxi will have a human driver present until the end of 2022, after which the cars will operate on their own.

Since late 2023, the Ioniq 5 Robotaxi are assembled at the Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre in Singapore (HMGICS) facility to be exported to the US.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bellan |first=Rebecca |date=2023-11-21 |title=Motional and Hyundai to jointly build IONIQ 5 robotaxi in Singapore |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/11/21/motional-and-hyundai-to-jointly-build-ioniq-5-robotaxi-in-singapore/ |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Ioniq 5 with e-Corner ===
A modified version of the Ioniq 5 was showcased by [[Hyundai Mobis]] at the [[Consumer Electronics Show#2023|56th Consumer Electronics Show]] in [[Las Vegas]] in January 2023. The vehicle is equipped with an "e-Corner" system which allows it to perform a crab walk, tank turn, diagonal driving and pivot turn. It features an in-wheel motor design that also integrates brake and steer by wire technology as well as an electric damper into a single package. Each wheel can accelerate, brake and steer independently.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 With e-Corner Modules Can Rotate Its Wheels 90 Degrees |url=https://insideevs.com/news/630245/hyundai-ioniq5-crab-walk-360-degrees/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>
